unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Independent or Not?
question_text: If two events, $A$ and $B$ , are independent, then which of the following statements is false?

choices.text: Knowing whether or not event A A occurs does not alter the probability that event B B will occur.
p ( A and B ) = p ( A ) ⋅ p ( B ) − p ( A or B ) p ( A and B ) = p ( A ) ⋅ p ( B ) − p ( A or B )
p ( A | B ) = p ( A ) p ( A | B ) = p ( A )
p ( B | A ) = p ( B ) p ( B | A ) = p ( B )
p ( A and B ) = p ( A ) ⋅ p ( B ) p ( A and B ) = p ( A ) ⋅ p ( B )
